There are a number of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel --everything from greasy spoons to five star dining. The 7+Fig shopping mall is a five minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: NoTellin
Reviews.Content: This hotel caters to convention goers/business people. It is not kid friendly. They charge for everything. There's no microwave or refrigerator in the room unless you pay for it. The parking is $15 per day, and this is not a safe location, so you cannot really park anywhere else. The parking lot attendant was quite pleasant. The closet space was minimal. The windows were dirty. The tub was actually dirty as well, and had long black hair in it. We waited at least 45 minutes for two hamburgers in the hotel restaurant. The restaurant service was below average in general. The pool is right next to the bar, on display, and there zero shade. It's also tiny. The hotel is not in a safe location. During the short time that we left the hotel and drove a few blocks away, there was a shooting, police, and helicopters. Around the corner there was a protest and a block was shut off to cars. It took about 30 minutes to drive around a 4 block radius. I would not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Staples Center events!”
Reviews.Author: VivaLasVegas06
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, I'm surprised at the bad reviews. Keep in mind - this is a HOLIDAY INN hotel and not the RITZ. However, it did exceed my expectations. The customer service was outstanding! The front desk personnell even arranged a taxi for our trip back to the airport which saved us the headache. The restaurant in the hotel had GREAT food!! We were only in LA for 2 days for an event at Staples Center and the hotel was right across the street. The rooms were immaculate and they have Herbal Essences shampoo (for those that care!) I'd definitely recommend this hotel! In my opinion, if you are looking for a cheap and nice hotel for an event at Staples Center this is a great choice for location and price. Tip: if you reserve your room online (on the Holiday Inn website), you can get the AAA rate which is only $119 compared to $140 a night. We do have an AAA card, but were never asked to show it at the front desk. A side note: the taxi ride we took from Holiday Inn to LAX was in a Lincoln Navigator and the cost was $45 plus tip. We took the "super shuttle" from LAX to Holiday Inn for $15 each ($30 total plus tip) and honestly I wasn't impressed. They make 2 trips around the airport and pack in as many people as possible in the van. We were crushed in there like sardines and then had to wait for lots of other stops to be made before we got to our destination. For the price, I can't complain much but I'd much rather spend the extra $15 and ride in comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but not too impressed”
Reviews.Author: threed82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hottel because of it's proximity to the Staples Center, which by the way couldn't have been better. A few complaints, the $20 breakfast vouchers you buy don't get you that far in their "Denny's style" restaurant, especially with a family of four. Also, one of the two elevators was broken and we probably spent 5-10 mins just waiting for the one elevator to pick us up at any given time. The room was decent, lots of space and semi-comfortable beds. Bathroom was clean and spacious. Parking was an additional $15 p/day but I suppose that's typical for downtown. Not bad overall.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: CCR032
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was close to the convention center and had several recent excellent reviews. The main problems: a tiny room that smelled musty, uncomfortable bed, only one working elevator working, and the room card did not work half the time (had to replace it 1-3x per day during a 4 day stay). More minor problems: the fitness room was very hot and had no air circulation (also tiny), recorded messages (e.g. when on hold) kept referring to a recent renovation, but no evidence of this could be seen--the decor was still dated, the restaurant and bar were shabby. Also it can be difficult to get a cab. The area is reasonably safe during the day, but sketchy after dark. The pluses: the restaurant staff was friendly and quick and the breakfast buffet for 9.95 was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “awesome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have come to LA every year for the x-games and we stay at the Holiday Inn. The staff is excellent, great service and they treat the guests like loyalty....love it and Tommy is great!!! We will be coming again in August 2005.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousNewYork_NY
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The staff here is very friendly - needed a ride to the airport and forgot to schedule it the day before but the staff member there (I think the name is Adam) was real nice and booked my shuttle. The room is really big and they also provide you with two complementary water bottles - which I have never seen anywhere else. You can hold your luggage in the hotel free of charge while you are out doing something else. The bar and restaurant are also very nice - the meal I had the restaurant was delicious (tomato ravioli something). The hotel is across an intersection from the Staples Center, so you can see people going to the Staples Center from the lobby. Would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fraudulent Charges!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This would have been a decent stay for Los Angeles, but the error in charges and the handling of it by the hotel made the stay sour!

Reviews.Title: “the staff was rude and they billed my card w/o authorization”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely rude and unhelpful!!! They billed my card a $68.00 damage fee, they said my room was damaged and it was completely spotless, the night i stayed there it was full of young adult who probably did destroy their rooms and they just decided that my room was damaged too!! when i asked the General Manager about the charges he did not give me a strait answer and said he had to call me back!!! the GM John Kelly was extremely rude and unhelpful and its been a week and he still has not called me back about these charges, what a great GM!! He is the most unprofessional and rude manger i have EVER talked to!!! He should be fired!!!! never stay at this hotel all the staff was rude, even at the restaurant!!!! Stay at the Radisson its right down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Comedy of errors”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based largely on the stellar recommendations at tripadvisor (and the hotel's close proximity to USC). What a mistake. There was only one working elevator, and it was remarkably slow. (Plus, it's a huge pain in the neck to scan your room card and select your floor once you're in the elevator.) The rooms are large, which is the hotel's one redeeming quality, but the front desk staff is strangely impersonal and ineffective. We called for a bellhop only to have our request ignored. On sunday am, we awoke to discover the streets outside the hotel were closed for the LA marathon. We were given no advance notice by the hotel, and when we attempted to return to the hotel later that morning, we were forced to pay to park in a lot three blocks away. The front desk staff refunded the hotel's parking fee for the nite ($15), but offered no apology for the inconvenience. The breakfast is overpriced and the exercise room is small. Do yourself a favor and find a holiday inn express nearby. You may think you're saving time by staying close to USC and Staples Center here, but you're really just asking for frustration.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I have stayed at in years! Right across from the Staples Center and Convention cennter”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn- City Center has the nicest Lobby, Bar and Rooms of any hotel that I have stayed at in some time. (Yes, a Holiday Inn believe it or not!) This hotel is outfited with nice hardwood crown moldings and chair rail. It has a well priced restaurnant and a menu that you would never expect at a Holiday Inn. I have heard they hired a chef from a five star hotel to re-create the restaurant and bar. The rooms are the biggest rooms in LA, with granite bathrooms, everything was very nice and new. The staff is very helpful and friendly.This is an amazing experience if you need to go to Downtown LA and don't want to spend $170 a night you will get a nicer room, better food, great service and a steal at around $109 a night.
